review: Decided to come with my friend to TGIF to catch up ,and have some drinks. How it was a Friday night I decided to go inside as soon as I station my car in order to put my name on the waiting list. I always get seats by the bar at night or if I'm coming for lunch. Something that really surprised me was the lady in the entrance looked ,and she's like YOU have one seat avlaiable for you let me clean it took her three mins and by the time my friend arrived I was about to get seated. So they were very organized last night! Regarding parking, and location: it is located in dolphin mall it's by the entrance of the mall but more towards P.F. Chang's and about parking they have a huge lot.  As soon as we were ready to order we already get appetizer apps which I believe is 15.00 for ultimate night. We decided to try the NEW chicken quesadilla which were phenomena as well as the NEW Nachos forgot their names. But we didn't just get that theirs much more to order we had mozzarella sticks/ pon-head baked potatoes. Mostly came to pick up drinks so my friend had two peach sangrias ,and I had from the summer collection the frozen lava flow it was very delicious the only this is its super cold ,and refreshing for next I will drink it by the beach. Our server was very patient, and quiet but lacked on a lot of speaking.. ,and gave us no recommendations on what to have or try. We had to come across it on our own.

I would rather eat anywhere else than to ever eat at this establishment again.  The food was not even that great, and the waitress made a huge stink about the bottomless appetizers. The staff was extremely unprofessional as well, our waitress was beyond ridiculous she literally watched us from the bar to make sure someone from our party did not share their bottomless appetizer.  Will never be coming back here!

I've come here a couple of times but it had been a while since my last visit, so we decided to eat here yesterday.  Food was pretty decent but service was so so bad I probably will not return. Orders weren't brought as ordered either (onions on nachos, cheese on kids' sliders, etc).  Place was empty when we arrived and even after a few more tables got occupied it was never busy (early pm on a Wednesday).  It took 40 minutes to get the kids' meals. If you have kids, you can relate and understand how frustrating this was. The entire "experience" was almost 2 hours, way tooooo long for a simple early dinner.  Bathrooms were dirty, other customers complained of same issue.
Great food and fast service! Not so packed , very attentive host  In and out within an hour!

Save yourself service drama and just sit at the bar. Great happy hour specials and daily specials. Good for a quick drink before cine bistro or just to prepare yourself for some shopping, no wait for drinks. Kind of a wait for food.

The service here is appalling. I came here with my girlfriend and her family and sat down at a table. We were all interested in ordering drinks, but one member of our party is in possession of an old vertically-oriented (portrait format for you MS Word users) under 21 ID. According to the employees there, it is company policy (we did not see it in writing) to swipe the under 21 IDs to verify the license holder's age. But if the magnetic strip is damaged, it will not register your age on the device and you will not receive your alcoholic drink, even when the date of birth printed on the license displays a date that is at least 21 years ago. We protested their refusal to serve one of our members a drink despite the clearly over 21 date of birth printed to no avail with two different managers. Three of us had already had the drinks brought over to us, but we told them we were refusing service, yet they still charged us for our drinks when were getting up to leave.  TGIF has one of the silliest policies I have ever heard of. They will never again get my hard earned money.

Terrible service!you can tell the managers don't know how to run a restaurant and the servers are careless.i went with my bf and he had a government issued security id with his birth date on it (he's 23) and they would not accept it even though the restaurant next door did. I also had an issue even though i had my regular id. The server called the manager because my id is vertical and they had to swipe it to check if it was legit. After swiping the id the manager looked like she didnt believe it was me and asked what my bday was and i said the month and date.she continued to question me even though she had already swiped my florida issued legit id and i told her my correct bday. Very rude and will not be going back to this tgi friday. Customers shouldn't feel like they're doing something wrong for ordering a drink.

The potato skins are the best appetizer in this place, is allways great. The potion is big, you can shar eit with 3-4 people. The places is nice, the service is not the best but is not awful either. Great burgers and stakes!!
The wait for your food is simple unacceptable even if the food was phenomenal (which is not) you waited so long for it that it's just not worth it.

Went to this place after the  Miami , Duke game. Service was terrible, waited upwards of 90 minutes for our food, finally served after multiple talks with manager. Orders were mixed up and my burger was cold. Ordered a water which never did arrive. Manager offered 20% off to compensate for poor service. I told him to keep the discount just give me the bill before I walk out. Of course that didn't occur until I walked up and told him again I was not waiting another minute. Terrible service and poorly managed. We will never go back. If I could give it a negative star rating I would.

The service was terrible I tried picking up a table outside because all of them were full of cups and plates I want to try to bring it inside to an employee which I believe to be the manager some black haired lady she really told me to just leave it back outside where I was sitting and sent me on my way never have ever had such bad service and this is coming from someone in the service industry!

TERRIBLE SERVICE! I ate there today with my family around 3:30, well I should say I entended to eat because I didnt even get the chance to. We ordered two medium flat iron steaks, chicken strips, and a burger. It took over 30 minutes for the food even though the restaurant was pretty empty. The burger my dad ordered arrived to the table wrong so we had to wait longer for his food and when he got It and we began to eat I saw that my steak was well done so I asked the waitress if she could get me another that was medium because I hate dry steak. She took It and came back saying "if you look at the middle of the steak it's slightly pink, you can look for yourself if you want" lol what?! First off medium is not slightly pink, it's pink. Secondly It wasn't even pink It was brown in the middle which should be the least cooked part. Thirdly instead of coming back with the food that was clearly prepared wrong and pretty much being like too bad that's what you get think about proper service. Ive worked at restaurants before and I get it's a mistake but It was handled poorly. The chef ended up asking if I was willing to wait for another steak or if I wanted to order something else but by that time my family was almost done with their plates and we had somewhere to be so I went without eating. Service 101 you fix the problem instantly, apologize, and typically make up for wasting their time seeing as you're taking their money, you should make sure it's worth what they're paying for.

Date Night Log 601-001 It's Wednesday It's Endless Apps. It a hell of a good time to go to TGI Fridays. Oh yeah. Place is empty and you get seated. New specials are shown and boom we ask the question of questions. Are shellfish cooked on the same pan as everything else, being my wife has a shellfish allergy.  Boom hostess checks. No everything is cooked separately. Out comes the waitress. Offers us alcohol, I decline, offers again. This is where I start to have an issue. If I say No, then don't offer it again. I might be a recovering alcoholic, I may not want any, i may be poor. Either way let's move on.  Waitress comes back hey you ready to order. Boom we are undecided, so why not offer us the new shrimp and steak. Hold up the hostess didn't relay my wife has a shellfish allergy. I then smirked and said she can't have that unless she wants to die she's allergic to shellfish. Waitress is oh wow ok got it. We then order the 3 for all appetizer. (Fyi the mozzarella sticks are fried in the same fryer as shrimp) oh course the waitress doesn't think of that as we didn't know it was, so when we ordered it 1 minute after stating the fact my wife has allergies. We thought it was all cooked in separate friers like the steaks are in pans. Out comes the food, the food tasted amazing, the Pretzel with cheese sauce, the mozzarella sticks, and the Sriracha chicken. Oh yeah she like it spicy. We then get our entrees. I get the amazing chicken that's cooked on a board and my wife gets chicken pasta. The waitress asks us how's everything. We said good. My wife finished her alcoholic drink and the waitress insists of another. She declined but said are you sure. Again, I felt at that point I was at tootsies and not fridays. The manager came by and asked how was everything. Explained how my chicken is cooked and was amazing. Good person to have there. Actually both managers are good. Keep them. Then we finished our food, and now Diamond (Fyi that's not her name but at this point like I said I felt I was at tootsies so that would be a stage name) asked if we were ready for some Tennessee Whiskey Cake. Again I look around made sure I was at Fridays and maybe not on a prank show. I don't want alcoholic stuff. Boom we get the bill. Waitress explains about a survey. Wait hold up. Aren't you not suppose to talk about surveys and ask to give a high score. I'm only saying this bc in my job we can't do that.  After I pay, and start to think I realized why I am seeing such bad scores on yelp for this Fridays. That they have had issues and needed to get there scores up from what they have so they over do things.  Here comes the kicker. We leave walk to Hot Topic (yes a yelp for there will be coming soon) and my wife fells her throat funny. After 5 minutes boom allergic reaction we go back to Fridays she getting a reaction to shellfish. Remember those amazing string breaded cheese called mozzarella we ate earlier. Yeah boom allergic reaction. Cooked on the same fryer as breaded shrimp. Ambulance comes takes her away. The two managers I do have to say thank you for taking care of my wife, speaking to your waitress, and to the cooks about if any food was cross contaminated. Now not letting us know that everything is cooked separate besides fried foods was wrong on the hostess and waitress part. So if you have a shellfish allergy you can eat here. Just beware the tasty fries, mozzarella sticks.. you know what anything that is fried in a fryer.  Again the two managers get 5 stars. The place gets 2 because they didn't think of the safety of my wife when she explained twice of her allergies. This should be brought up in meetings and corporate setting. Because in the end of the day it isn't the impression you give me in the begginng it's the impression I get at the end.
I would place negative stars if possible. We ordered via uber eats and the order took 2 hours!!!!!! Food arrived cold. Ribs were tiny.

The service was terrible order the beers and it took 17 minutes to bring them back when there was no one in the restaurant, then it took over 35 minutes to bring the food and when it arrived it was cold! Lousy place I will not come back to go. We had to call the waitress 3 times to be served never helped. HORRIBLE SERVICE!

Awful!! Nothing like advertised. Rude staff! Just plain awful!! Nothing as advertised! I got potato skins that came with government cheese and bacon bits! Was expecting something more home made or professionally made rather than this nasty food nasty service at nasty smell and nasty people

This is a corporate restaurant. It's not going to be something gourmet or out of this world but they always serve good food with cheap drinks and great service. Never had a bad time. Love the spinage dip and the mozzarella sticks!
I had dinner at this location. The service was good and the food was awesome. I had the flat iron steak and mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes where amazing!

Terrible experience. Sat at the bar.. I am a 34yr old man and was with a date when we were rudely asked for ID after we had been given the drink menu.. the bartender took my dates ID and gave it over to a woman with an old yellow ID card reader that looked like a Walkman and said the card wasn't scanning correctly with the machine so she couldn't serve her alcohol. We proceed to ask her to try again and she was not cooperating, I then gave her my ID to scan to see if it was maybe the card reader that was malfunctioning. Lone and behold my sideways ID didn't take through the reader as well. If it was the reader that was malfunctioning how did everyone else receive a drink at the bar? Were they not IDing or was it just us that were singled out to think audacious behavior and treatment. We left.

Service is terrible. The amount of time you wait for your food is ridiculous. We sat near the bar and watched 3 sets of people leave because they had not been served. I'm not sure how this place is still open and running

Worst customer service ever. Stood at the door for 30 minutes and no one attended me. No hostess. We asked 3 employees to seat us and they said they couldn't until the hostess sat us. Everyone is so rude and inattentive. No one there knows what they're doing and shouldn't even be working. The TGIF at dolphin mall is shit

Poor service for large groups (party of 8). We honestly felt like the server just did whatever because either way he'd get a nice tip since it was automatically added into our bills. He left out drink orders, desert orders, was never around. The most we saw him was when it was time to pay.  This is the second time I've had an issue with TGI Fridays so I don't think I'll return.

I enjoy TGI fridays very much in New York where I'm from. Moved down to Florida recently and decided to visit this tgi. First we waited 30 mins plus for two steaks. When it came out one of my sides were wrong and they gave me broccoli, but the broccoli came with a inedible sticker!! They gave me a 20 percent discount to attempt to compensate me. The waitress and the host had explained the sticker is from the broccoli bag.. what's that mean? should the box the vegetable comes in be on my plate as well? and the manager was nowhere to be seen or found. We will never be back.

Ate at the bar. Bartender is tentative, very polite and looks like Timbaland.  I like Timbaland. Though, place has a musty smell...a mixture of disinfectant with a touch of a wet mop that has not dried properly. Reminiscent of my junior high school cafeteria. Food was delicious and was served quickly. I'd come back.

I had a terrible experience at the location at THE FALLS (see my review about that) and as a result TGIFs invited us to dinner at another location. We chose this location at Dolphin Mall. Dinner at 6pm on Saturday for 7 people. They did a great job. At first the hostess said the wait would be 45 minutes for a table and we were about to leave when the manager (a young lady, blonde) stopped us and found a table. The waiter was very efficient. Water glasses filled quickly and he manged to bring the orders out as we requested (kids' meals first).  Despite being a peak time there was no delay in the service and the staff was very friendly and professional.  My conclusion is that the managers at this location now how to staff their team and manage the place. The experience was a complete 180 compared to The Falls. I won't be going back to the falls location but would be happy to go back here.

We went here yesterday Dec 7, 2016 and sat down @7 pm the place was empty looked almost like a ghost town. We are celebrating my mothers birthday from the time we sat down the nightmare began. No one came to greet us for over 13 min when it is supposed to be 2-3 min  it was a waiter who never told us his name just took our drink order and apps and left he took another 12 min to brink our drinks and brought them one by one instead of all togeather. Then he finically takes our order our food didn't come for over 1 hr And again didn't come all togeather he brought out each dish one by one staggered every 2 min. You can tell our food was sitting under a heat lamp for a while and that it was cold and the taste was stale.  Then we asked him for another one of my moms cherry limeade he never brought her a new one just put some sofa in it and brought it back my mom said it taste like dish soap.He never offered or came by to refill drinks and we stayed thirsty all through dinner. So then I asked the next waiter behind me to speak to a manager and he asked what was the problem I told him he said he was going to get a manager and never did . The. I had to walk to the bar and tell them I wanted a manager and now. I tell the manager what the waiter did and his horrible service he said he didn't know anything and offered a discount. The whole meal should have been free for the worst birthday dinner in the world. People you can get better service at McDonald's and Burger King than here please save your money never ever ever eat here it is and was very horrible and they really don't care if I can help as many people as possible I will thanks for reading

I've been going to this TGIF for over 8 years now and I can't say it's the best food in town because it really isn't, but you get what you pay for. For a quick bite and a couple of drinks, and their specials, you can't ask for more. The staff is attentive for the most part, and it's been better since they remodeled the place. Favorites: Loaded Mashed Potatoes, Grilled Chicken, and Mojitos.

Why is this establishment even open as a restaurant. When I walked in all the damn tables were filthy and no one even cared. After finally watching the manager clean off a table an sat my party a cockroach was on my seat. No apologies or anything The manager just cleaned off the table without saying a word and we moved.  Totally gross

I really enjoy out neighborhood Friday's in North Miami, but something was a bit off with the location inside Dolphin Mall. My fiance had the same chicken dish as she does all the time but the taste was just a bit sub par she told me. I had something different that night and it was OK so the comparison was a little off, but overall the experience at Dolphin Mall was just "OK." I do need to mention, just so they can read this and do something about it going forward, about the mens room situation. I will stop with the details right there and that should tell you everything you need to know. So yes, it needed some attention and the place was not really "that" busy for a weekend night. Hope they make things better so we will want to stop by some day again.

Long story short, my friend could not buy a drink even though she was over 21 because her ID was vertical.  It's a nice staff and everything but TGI FRIDAYS  (the company) recently decided to not allow anyone with a vertical ID (those who are under 21 when the drivers license is issued receive an ID that is vertical instead of horizontal) to buy alcoholic drinks even if the ID shows their date of birth is over 21.  I hear that it's due to a recent law suit. Whatever, if you want to celebrate 21, don't go here.
It took three hours to get our food and in the end one person's meat was over-cooked and another person's was under-cooked. Bad customer service over all.
The bartenders are friendly and food was fast and delicious. I recommend to sit at the bar with Melo. She always takes great care of me.

My husband and I visited this place every 3 or 4 days and the experience had been pretty good. Today I went with my co-workers and the shift manager made us have a shameful experience. My husband and I are going so often that we always have rewards coupons. Today I tried to use a coupon and my co-worker bought an endless app and the manager did not want to honor it because it could not be used with the endless offer and I said I could understand .. Then I asked her to separate the tickets and she refused. I was very annoyed by her lack of professionalism and her face when she told us that she could not. At the end she honor it because she could not say no to the separation of the tickets. Each customer buys what they like and if you can not give a good service as a manager then you should not damage a good business as it is TGFriday...   You should study to become a manager, it is obvious that you came to that position not for studies or knowledge because you lack professionalism. Instead I can say from the manager man that the store has that he is a pro and makes a difference. I will not go to this place while you are the one on duty. I wish I knew your name but I think you're the only woman who has this place as a manager...

Awful service at this place.  We sat on a perimeter table and the bartenders were actually counting money from their tip bucket while we waited for service.  The manager had to come to table and had to handle our issue.  The server didn't even apologize for the oversight and forgot our order!  Horrible place!  Stay away!
Our server was a little bit slow, the food was good, the frozen margaritas was very good. However the Arnold Palmer tasted bland no flavor, and he never refilled our waters. .

This place gets worse every time. The prices here are too steep for the quality of the food. Sure some dishes are great but a lot of the menu needs an update. Ordered nachos thinking they were actual nachos only to to receive 8 taco shells broken in half with smeared beans on top. Terrible. Service is not good at all. Our waiter forgot one of our orders but remembered to put it on the bill. How convenient. I will try to stay away from this place.

This is by far the worst Friday's I've been too. Everytime I come here or place an order To go they always provide horrible service. They always mess the orders up EVERY time I order food to go. Avoid this Friday's iF you can.

Not bad, not great just TGI Fridays and the usual stuff. While I got the new Jack Daniels sliders, the rest of my party got entrees. The sliders weren't bad at all and for sure hit the spot considering I wasn't too hungry. The sliders were good, but had a bit too much bread around the small patties. The cheese was good and the Jack Daniels sauce had a nice smoky kick. The French dip sandwich mom got wasn't bad either and my dad's parmesan chicken with Mac and Cheese was good as well. But again it wasn't anything out of the ordinary.  Service wasn't bad either, our waitress was friendly and very sweet. She was quick and prompt and answered all of our questions.  Now why three stars do you ask? Because the women's bathroom was absolutely disgusting, for some reason the stall had dirt near the toilet paper dispenser and if was just gross. Again it was another situation where I should have mentioned it to someone but I just didn't. Though it may have been because it was Saturday and they were busy but it was still kind of off putting.  Again, it's a TGI Fridays it's not bad and it's not great but it's a good place to eat with family and just have a nice Saturday night dinner together. Plus it's a bit of a cheaper option compared to what else is available at Dolphin Mall that isn't the food court.

Came to this location because I always frequent the area and I normally have a great time but apparently management has implemented a policy in which only sideways IDs can get alcohol. I had to get up and leave during my dining experience because my friend who is OF LEGAL AGE would not be served because of her ID not being vertical. I don't even know if that legally makes sense but they would not budge on it regardless of the fact that the DMV no longer allows the change until the ID expires. Maybe rethink you're ridiculous policy so you don't lose paying customers?

This was our last option since everything else in Dolphin was a 45+ minute wait. Let me start off with the fact that they greeted us with saying, "we have no more menus, is that ok?"  Uhm yeah, sure I guess?... So we sat down, and Sabrina (our waiter) was very good and attentive. She was very nice and friendly, but the food was just bad. We ordered onion soup, beers and a chicken plate which was anything but good. It was just so "Blah". The beer was warm and the soup was cold. My boyfriend's mac n' cheese had no taste and the cheese was burnt. Took a bite to try and it was crunchy. Not a fan of mac n' cheese to begin with, but I don't think that's how it's supposed to be. I'm being nice and giving it two stars due to service, but won't come back.

I had the All American Stacked Burger, sorry to say it had no flavor, apparently the Chef forgot to use salt. The fries were also flavorless, I didn't even eat them! Service was awesome though; fast and corteous.

Dined in tonight with a party of 5. It was pretty empty. The waitress was sweet but forgot one of our entrees even though the place was pretty dead. She took it off our bill and gave us a discount, which was really nice because we ended up being too full anyway. However, this is the second time I dine at this location and get home with a HORRIBLE stomach-ache. Maybe it's just coincidence but I am going to stay away from this place in the future.
This place is awful. Wasn't full at all and the service was incredibly slow. The waiter did not visit often. The food was unimpressive. Very disappointing.
Overpriced for basic food. The chicken was not well cooked. It had to much going on at once. My boyfriend felt like throwing up because the chicken looked weird.

Happy Hour on a Sunday during playoff football...unheard of! Not drink specials...HAPPY HOUR! I'm not saying TGIF is the best restaurant or tastiest or any "BEST OF", but it is a lifesaver for your budgeted drinking and eating needs.

My husband an I went in for lunch and we were immediately attended. Our server was Ani Mari, the kindness, most lively, and attentive server I've ever met. Our experience was great because of her. I would say the food wasn't as good as I expected. My Friday's Shrimp was a little in the burnt side. Too over cooked for me. Thanks to Ani Mari, she kept the drinks coming and checking on us frequently.  Our server gave this review the 4 stars, the missing star would have to be coming from the food. This place has new face lift. I noticed it was remodeled inside. The best thing that location could done.

Bad, bad, bad. It's a management problem, I am sorry for all the people that work there because maybe they are trying to do their best, but if you have only 3 or 4 people attending a restaurant this size, of course it's gonna be a mess. I waited like 10 minutes for someone to attend me at the entrance, then we waited more for someone to take our order, after 30 minutes our food arrived but the drinks didn't, we had to reorder them, the food was bad, then we had to waaaaaait for the check. I saw only 3 people attending all the tables and the guests at the entrance, maybe it was the same inside the kitchen. Managers have to do something to prevent this, you're better trying Cheesecake Factory.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE PLACE!!  THE PLACE WAS DIRTY!  THE SERVICE I experienced WAS SO BAD!  Nobody helped us at the entrance.  I had to seat myself,  clean the table myself. And it took forever for the server to bring the order and 10 times longer to bring the bill. I'm not coming to this shit hole. The only reason I stayed was I was starving and at the end the food was horrible and extremely overpriced.

The service was just horrible. I was ask to wait 20min to be seated when half the place was empty . Also order a Philly stay which the menu says shredded beef but yet comes in a patty . I won't be coming to this Friday's again . Also the host was completely lost and didn't know what she was doing . HORRIBLE

an hour wait for appetizers,  now I see how they trick you to order the endless apps, by the time you get it you want to leave already and not reorder. Staff is somewhat rude and unfriendly.  Would avoid in the future
TGI FRIDAYS is awesome the Burgers,Chicken Fingers,Fries,Nachos,Salad,Mozzarella Sticks and Happy Hour Specials are amazing

The waitress was really good, energetic! But the food was mediocre. The hamburger had no cheese or sauces, a boring burger. Jack Daniels chicken was alright. The fries were cold. The only thing that was good was the appetizer. Never going back!

This review is not about the food, or the service. I think anyone who has been to a chain like Chilli's or Applebee's pretty much gets an idea of what this place is like in terms of the menu.  My review is solely about the happy hour. This place, by far, has one of the best happy hours of all restaurant/bars. Well drinks are $2.50 (how can you beat that?).. and many of the appetizers are half off as well (including wings).  Normally when I go out for drinks I try and check out a new spot but lets face it.. sometimes you just want to go to a place that is safe and easy and requires minimal effort. This place does just that. I've come in many times with the guys to kick back a few and chill.  Awesome place for happy hour.

What can I even say about this specific location. I don't know in what area they're falling short but they really need to get it together. We got there and our drinks were late, 35 mins after our appetizers come out.  When we finally got out entrees my boy friend was missing an entire part of his entree. He order steak with ribs but there were no ribs. I then realized my meal came with two sides and one was missing. At this point it was just a big FAIL and we were over this meal.  The waitress kept making excuses about being busy and making excuses for the kitchen. For me spending a good $80, I must say this was one of our worst dining experiences ever.
Inexpensive and quick lunch.  Ok service when you seat by the bar. For $8.00 can't ask for much more
I had never been this location expected crowed . It was quiet at lunch time on a Wednesday.. The service was fast and drinks... Waitress was nice and attentive to our needs ....
This staff has ZERO personality. They could get more business from me and other mall employees if they actually talked to their customers and not looked annoyed all the time.

This rating is solely based on the bar during Happy Hour.  I will admit that I don't really like the food here. It's not that it's terrible. It's just nothing to write home about.  The babes and I used to come here often for the late night Happy Hour specials. Their Happy Hour ends at 7pm but begins again at 9pm until closing at 2am.  Sweet! The bartenders are down to earth and know their stuff! The service at the bar is always quick and friendly. It's always entertaining to watch them practicing juggling bottles. Most of the bartenders here will remember your drink of choice if you frequent the location. They're good like that!

Haven't been here in a while. They remodeled the whole place and it looks really nice. Staff was friendly and food was good. It's the first time I come here and that I didn't have to wait for over 30 minutes. So I guess all the changes are good!

I haven't been to a TGI Friday's in years and decided to stop by since I was at the mall and wanted some few drinks. The bartender was very friendly and made us really good drinks. I also ordered a regular cheeseburger with fries. It came out really good! I would definitely come back here.

I am currently sitting with a 9 top. We are here for a friend's birthday. It is currently 10:15 pm, we arrived at 9:32 pm and just received our bar drinks. We have asked for water three times and have yet to receive  at least that. We put in our 1 order of mozzarella sticks 30 minutes ago and it still has not arrived. Dissapointed? Trust me, we are. The slick do-nothing manager came over fifteen minutes ago and could not even apologize for the wait we've been going through. He offered to have the birthday guys drink on the house....that is all...it is currently 10 17 pm. Been here for about 45 minutes and water has still not been brought to the table. I have worked in the restaurant business for a while now and this type of service, I know, is highly unacceptable. I will not be dining at this TGI Fridays location ever again and will not recommend it to anyone I know. Extremely inattentive servers and the manager...even worse. Almost one hour and our food is not here. Water is not at the table and this place is completely empty and slow since it's a Thursday night. Terrible, Terrible service.
AWSOME service probably cause we are regulars lol but...the hole place changed and the veterans service still super friendly

This is a place to go when you're at Dolphin Mall and would like good drinks and SOME good appetizers. However, the food overall is Meh! Our server, Melodies (yes, that's her name) was outstanding! So good, that she remembered us from the prior visit a few weeks before. In fact, she remembered what we ate. She makes a fantastic Bloody Mary. She's always attentive and friendly. This place is very casual and laid back.

So I had the pick 3 for $16.99 and it was alright. I picked a broccoli and cheese soup to start my meal and it was really good. Super tasty. Then I had the 10 oz sirloin steak with parmesan steak fries and mashed potatoes. The steak wasn't good at all but the parmesan fries were really good.  The best part was desert. I had the vanilla bean cheesecake which was fantastic. I actually want another slice. So yeah. Everything was really good except the steak.

I just left this Fridays about 15 minutes ago and I am still starving. I ordered a all-American burger which came with fries. First the burger was very small, to give you a comparison to it's size steak and shake had thicker parties on it's burgers. It had to be the size of a double cheeseburger from McDonalds as far as width. My fries were cold, and after I requested a new fresh batch and are one of the fries, I can only assumed my fries were reheated via microwave. I am very disappointed in the food here, and the service could have been a tad bit better. Never again

First of all, the waitress was awesome! She was very sweet and was ready to meet our expectations. Second of all, the hibachi skewers were ABSOLUTELY DIVINE!!! Crunchy on the outside and tender in the inside. The miso glaze made everything better! And the brownie obsession... simply amazing!!!

Terrible service, mediocre food, and childish disrespectful management. Lets just hope you come in on a weekday when its not busy or else youll probably wait a couple of hours before you eat. Save yourself a headache when youre hungry at the mall and go somewhere else.

By far the worst service I have ever received at a Friday's. The bar is dirty and the only guest are workers from the previous shift drinking. Our bartender is too busy socializing to see that we are waiting to be served. When we asked to pay our checked we get dirty looks and complaints from the bartender. Do not eat here .

gross...smells of sh@t and shame. Service at this tgi friday is poor waited 15 min to even be aknowledged after seated. Bathroom was 3 rd world disgusting, flat iron steak was like a shoe over cooked, bar smells gross, they brought frozen mac and cheese ( how do you mess that up?) they brought the wrong sides for 3 of our 4 meals. We will not be back...this TGI fridays will be gone soon if they dont clean up their act.

Terrible service! Our waitress was nice but they seem to be short staffed! Bathrooms were disgusting and when we asked to get plates for our appetizers, they tpld us the small plates were dirty. I wont be coming back!

We stopped by on our way to Homestead after the UM vs. Boston game. The ambience was ok; not really much to expect on Black Friday at Dolphin Mall. The reason why I gave it 4 stars? Our server was Memphis (Michael). Super sweet server; very attentive!

This was the worst TGI Fridays experience.  If I could put zero stars, I would.  From beginning to end, everything was a mess.  A girlfriend and I walked in to a disaster.  There was no host/ess at the front, so we waited for about 7 minutes to be greeted by anyone and finally a girl that was sitting at the table in the very front comes over and says, "Oh, you haven't been helped?  I'm not clocked in, but I will help you."  Okay, are you trying to get me to sing your praises because you lifted a finger off the clock?  I'm confused.  We head to our table, waited an additional 15 minutes for our waiter to come over.  When she finally did we placed our order for everything so we weren't neglected for another half hour.  My friend ordered mozzarella sticks for her app and those came in a pretty timely manner.  Then about 15 minutes later, dinner came.....along with another order of mozz sticks.  I told the runner that we already had those and that my app was missing and incorrect.  She said, "No problem, I'll go check it out."  My friend is sitting here with her dinner in front of her with no silverware, I'm sitting here with no food.....I found silverware on another table for my friend to eat her dinner, and the common "15 minute" theme that the night carried....here came our waitress, still empty handed.  I told her to just go ahead and cancel my order and do not worry about it.  I then explained to her that this was honestly the worst customer service.  She said, "How is this the worst?"  With her hand on her hip and everything, giving me attitude about being an upset customer.  I am the manager of a hair salon in South Beach which at the end of the day is the service industry, and I have never been treated this way, nor have any of my clients.  Needless to say, there are more details, but no need.  This place is a disgrace to the TGI Fridays franchise.

We got there and we got a table right away, we waited for 20 minutes for the waiter to come, then we ordered 2 blue long island ice tea, and a vocka and cranberry, it tasted like regular juice, we told the waiter and he didn't care much and he said that the manager was being very strict with the alcohol, he didn't try to fix the problem or anything,  he left right away from the table. He took about 20 more minutes to come back, so we got up and left without ordering anything.... I'm very disappointed of the service, and drinks here, I have been to other tgi fridays and this one sucks, I don't think I'll be back.

Hopefully I get the same waitress when I'm out with the guys. If you want an appetizer you can't go wrong with the Jack Daniels Sampler or try the new Japanese Hibachi Skewers. The sizzling chicken and shrimp was amazing this night, sorry no pic I devoured my food immediately. The ratio of Jack to coke was perfect. Service is more times then not better than average and so is the food. But I have to say my date and forever girlfriend was extremely patient with our waitress and her constant flirtatiousness with me. Simply replying "I've gotten use to it." I love her :D. Thanks for the time and if I could recall the waitresses name I would have said see " ". Well on to the next review guys.

We came on a Saturday night around 7, and the place was pretty empty. We've been here plenty if times and its never been great, but ok. We came after the movies with the kids and we were seated right away, but it took our waiter a while to come over and great us. We placed our drink orders, appetizer and food order at the same time since we already knew what we wanted.  Our drinks took about 10 minutes, and the place wasn't even full. Our Main dish arrived and it was a mess. 1) Our appetizer didn't make it out 2) My salad didn't make it out either. 3) I tried the new chicken with tortellini, and the plate only comes with FOUR! How do I know, I was splitting it with my wife since we weren't that hungry after the movies.  So she had two and I had two, and split the Chicken.  4) My sons' ribs were dry, overcooked, and barely any meat on them. I called the waiter over when our meal arrived and let him know my disappointment and our missing foods, he checked with the manager and the kitchen and told us yes, they gave our appetizer to another table, and he didn't know what happened to the salad.  He didn't seem to concerned about trying to make it right or try and make us happy.  They finally brought the appetizer (Mac&Cheese bits) when we were finished with our meal and it looked nothing like the picture in the menu.  They were half the size and way over cooked and burned.   I was totally expecting the manager to come over and see how we were doing since they had multiple errors and were very dissatisfied with the meals and experience.  He never made it over to our table, but the table next to us that had a young couple and a very pretty woman got all the attention.  The manager and about 4 other servers were constantly walking up to their table, chatting with them, etc.   After he brought us our check, he removed the appetizer but had an extra drink charge on my check.  I had to grab him and point it out so he could remove it.  This place has never been special, but bearable.  NEVER AGAIN!.  I will no longer dine at this TGIFridays.  Only reason for the 1-star they did a good job signing Happy B-day to my son.

Don't bother. The service was ridiculously slow, the place was a noisy madhouse and the food was horrible. Our salads tasted like they came from McDonald's...really. My drink came with a piece of paper in it and it took a half an hour to get replacement. Will never go to another Fridays again after this experience and certainly not the one at Dolphin Mall.

ordered a parmesean encrusted chicken was maybe a 3 ounce piece , asked for manage r, SARA , very useless to go there with regulars , no wonder all your good bartenders left to dave and busters . wont be back ever again , no cosistency , there steaks are horrible and SARA is the worst manager in the world , period , go back to school and learn customer service before you cost your company  any more money    , on top of a 25 min WAIT in  THE EMPTY dump,

Horrible service! Dont sit by the bar fair warning first time I was there waited 15 mins ! For one stupid drink. The second time I sat by the booth by the bar n what a great not so smart idea stupid laid took 10 mins for water then we told her we wanted cold coronas I see the bartender put it there she see them nother 5 mins later she pop them open n brings it to us like wtf. Then the third time they sat us by the bar what my freaking luck oh n guess what get dumb bloned air head again she took 29 mins to get are appetizer when it was not pack bc she was running her mouth about gossiping like I don't go to tgif to listen to the people life and who they went out with or freak with. Totally unprofessional place. Every time I have step in there I always have a bad time and I have tried to go with different people each time and still same thing happens again

Waited a long time to be acknowledged by the waiter. Ordered an alcoholic drink which the waiter partially spilled on my new iphone6.  I clearly wasn't amused and left. Manager asked what happened as we were leaving but did nothing about it. I highly doubt I will come back.

Well can I give a zero no but I'm not happy when I got to a restaurant and get food poisoning I went there Sunday because I must admit they have a great happy hour But I ate a blue cheese burger and I'm still feeling sick  I will reach out to them but please don't eat the burgers there the meat tasty funny and the blue cheese was bad  Inexcusable for such a large chain !
OMG!!! Is this place still open? If you're eating at TGI Fridays you're not trading Yelp. Enjoy your chicken fingers.

Alright boys & Girls, I came here about a couple of weeks ago and I gave this place two stars, the main reason was that the food me and my friends ordered were bad and didn't live up to its expectations, plus the service took forever to get our orders and get our food out to us. So to be fair & unbiased - I gave them the benefit of the doubt like my favorite old saying "every dog has its day" that day wasn't theirs... So i got there around 2200 (10:00pm) met up a couple of friends... the server got there quick, and she was very attentive. The appetizer spinach dip was excellent freshly made, the tortillas didn't taste stale at all. My friends ordered half rack ribs, sirloin steak & half rack rib with fries, and i ordered of course the healthy petite USDA 6oz steak with asparagus (gotta watch my figure) ... the food came out perfect! Everything was cooked properly, nothing was stale as it was before and it actually tasted good. The bad side was that we ordered the brownie sundae thing for desert it was good but to find out there was 2 pieces of long hair melted inside the brownie (YUCKKKK)... but the manager apologized and got us another literally 2 minutes later... very good A+ BIG IMPROVEMENT!!!

Went there for a late lunch on a Sunday. First off, I have to say that the music was too loud.  It was a bit annoying.  We were seated at a table that had the sun right on us, so we asked to be moved.  We were accomodated and got a nice comfortable booth.  Minutes after we were seated the server came by to take our order and we were ready.  The food came promptly and it was very good.  The soup and salad all you can eat is a great deal (you get bread, a drink, soup, and salad for 7 bucks, including ordering different soups!) Our server was fantastic!  She memorized all our orders without writing it down and got everything right.  Only reason for a 4 star and not 5 was the extremely loud music.  A very good meal for 4 for $40, tip included. The bread was remodeled (from previous visits), and it was awesome!  Light and flaky and warm; deelish! Won't mind coming back here again!

I dine at this Friday's quite a bit since it's near my house. I love anything from the menu that has the words "Jack Daniels" in front of it. My fav is the Sample. Only negative is that it gets packed on the weekends because of its location. (just right of Dolphin's Mall main entrance) I'm a Fan. 4 Stars.

The service was extremely poor. My server didn't even notice that I needed silverware when she gave me my food. She left and I thought she was getting some and when she came back she was empty handed. I had to ask her for silverware for my entire party. The food was not cooked how I asked. The manager was extremely rude and does not know the meaning of customer service. You want food from here, take it to go! I'm normally an easy to please person and I don't ever write bad reviews. I guess there's a first for everything.

I've been to many tgif all over the state of florida and this is by far the worst that i have been to. The service was eehh ok i guess but the food was really crap. We went for lunch on a sunday and there was only 3 other people seated at the restaurant so they had the time to make the food right. I mean how hard is it to cook a steak medium. Never again.

I've been here almost a million times but one experience actually lowered my visits to barely none.  It was around 3:30pm and it was not very busy. I was seated to a booth at the bar and given the menus by the hostess. The waitress came up to us after about 10 minutes (mind you, I am being very literal right now not exaggerating) and asked if we wanted to drink anything. We said yes. We waited another 10 minutes to get our orders after making my friend stare down the waitress who was behind the bar giggling with her co-workers, drinking coke and looking at the sky all at the same time. She finally comes and we get our order in. Creamed spinach appetizer and two plates of the chicken & shrimp cajun paste (WHICH IS AMAZING AND THE ONLY REASON I COME TO TGI'S). We get our appetizer and remember that we didn't get our forks. So my friend and I had a choice whether to stare down the girl or get forks ourselves. We got up and got the forks. We get our food and everything. She asked us how everything was and we said fine. Well she forgot to ask for a refill......so another stare down game began again. We actually had to ask another waiter to get us a refill.  Food is done and I remember that I have my tgi friday's reward for a free meal. So my friend and I were gonna split everything. Cajun pasta + drink=1 bill Cajun pasta + appetizer=1 bill This means one of us gets a free pasta and only pay for the drink and the other pays for cajun pasta and appetizer BUT we had another coupon to use for that. So the cat and mouse game began at this point on. We were waiting for the waitress to come so we can explain this to her. 7 minutes later...we explain and I tell her I get a free meal with the reward and she says I need to speak to a manager so I said okay 6 minutes later...the manager comes I show her the email and she says I need to pull up the code from the website through my phone which will take forever 15 minutes later...I finally get the code and hunt down the waitress. she comes, gets the code and leaves 8 minutes later..she forgot to split the bill plus add the coupon on and says we need to talk to the manager again 5 minutes later..manager approves and we wait for our bill 7 minutes later..(stare down game) and we get the bill split with all the coupon perks but she gave my bill twice and my friends never came so we wait again 4 minutes later....we get the right bill and at this point we are so fed up by the service and the manager even gave us attitude when we showed her the coupons but come on times are tough.  The girl didn't even ask for a refill once, no forks, gaves us the biggest attitude, did not do her job, socialized with her coworkers the whole time, made us stare at her for her attention, and was just plain rude. NO TIP! We came one time again after that and ended up with the same girl. She was decent that time, but we actually gave her tip :) FOOD IS GREAT. SERVICE NEEDS SOME HELP!

Came here for dinner, the hostess asked us how many and told us there were not tables inside when i looked I saw one and she was like oh that's a table for six. I was like well nobody else is waiting so we will take it. I really didn't want to sit outside.  We came for the 3 course meal for 12.99. The selection of mix and match were excellent. You get a complete appetizer, dinner and desert. Our server was very friendly and the kitchen was timely with the food. I was impressed.  I will be back soon.

Perhaps it's evolving tastes on my part, or maybe it's that they completely overhauled their menu recently, but Fridays has really gone downhill fast.  The food is greasy, tasteless and some of the menu items are downright frightening.  Who fries Macaroni and Cheese or Green Beans & puts it out as an appetizers.  Only in America I guess!!! They have a limited selection of salads and the overall quality of the entrees has gone down.  The food mostly tastes of rancid cooking oil, not so good if you ask me. Service is OK, nothing really notable.  That's why I try to stay away from most chains or fast food joints.  We're in Miami, with the amount of high quality restaurants present here, surely you shouldn't waste your money on going to Fridays.

Lately I've been trying to stay away from major chains like this - but it was an easy option for a Friday night.  There wasn't a long wait at 7pm... service was good... and food was ok.  My favorite part of the meal were the drinks.  Ordered a sangria and my mom got some sort of a red mojito (pomegranite? cherry? not sure). Ordered from the section of the menu with smaller portions... because who needs the "regular" (read: massive!) portion anyway?!  Got a steak with "gourmet" mac-n-cheese.  Nothing AMAZING, but it did it's job, and was just the right serving- not to mention they cooked the steak properly! (woohoo!) Will definitely be ordering from that side again. It's not my FAVORITE place to go - but if I'm at Dolphin Mall and not in the mood for Cuban (Mojitos), or ultra-expensive steak (Texas de Brazil), you'll find me here.

Haven't eaten At Fridays for a while and bow I remember why.   We were seated quickly, probably only restaurant at mall that wasn't crowded. Go figure.  We were told our server was excellent.  Appetizer came quick bit no utensils to eat it with.  Never had pot stickers that were dry in my life until now.  Asked two people for utensils and we finally got some with out so much as an apology.   Then food came and my flavorless  capt morgan chicken sandwich was covered in sauce.  When I was done the single napkin I was given was soaked and my hands still covered in sauce.  Again asked for napkins and got some with out an apology.   Fridays lost a customer for good.

Ok I know its FRIDAYS .. a chain.  They are all the same right? No. They are not. The service here is ok with the servers but the hostesses are totally clueless.  Then the place smells like someone mopped it with a dirty water.  Seriously, the last time my daughter said if she had to eat inside she would gag.  Is this really what they want? So you sit outside to have to bear the smokers and the squealing tires of the crazy Valet dudes (piece of advice - don't Valet at Dolphin, I have seen how they treat those cars). The food portions have been getting smaller and smaller, and honestly the food also has not been getting better in any way.  If anything much worse.  The food lately has been greasy and unappealing.  The sirloin steak and broccoli I ordered was tasteless.  It used to be seasoned nicely.  Not so much anymore!  The broccoli was overcooked. They don't even try to pretend that they want to make it appealing.  Its like when you slap your food on a plate in the kitchen and you are on your way to eat in front of the TV.  Presentation is that bad. Dolphin has other places, this one is a good one to miss.

I hadn't been to a Friday's in around 8 years (since high school) and last night reminded why.  We were famished after a couple games of pool at D&B and went downstairs to grab a bite at Friday's. Big mistake. Our server took forever to take our order. By the time we got our food, our burgers were cold and we had to wait for our fourth party's entree for a good 5 minutes. When her chicken came, the server told her they were out of the mac n' cheese, a side our waiter had so eagerly recommended.  By the time we asked for our bill, they were closing up so I believe that to be the reason for bad service (tired staff) and no food. We all had to pay with different cards and that seemed to upset our already pleasant waiter who rolled his eyes and walked away. So, will I come back to this or any other Friday's for subpar food and terrible service? I think not!

I have been long time ago to the one at the Falls and recently to the one on Ocean Drive. Not impressed and I don't think I will try it again. Greasy, junk food overloaded with more junk foood. I guess many of you still love this kind of fattening food chains as it is always full, but it is not for me. Sorry

TGIF is a nice place to go to when your in the mall. But honestly the only reason I go is for their mash potatoes and their jack Daniels menu. If it wasn't for that, I would never go. The service is always good. But the food isn't always consist ant.

Today we went to Dolphin Mall TGI Fridays and I was pleased with the service. This is the 2nd time I go and I have never had a problem. I was actually seated right away (at 7pm on a Saturday) and the hostess was very quick and efficient....just the way I like it....! LOL!  Anyways, my only complaint is that the salad didn't look too fresh, hence the 4 stars instead of 5.  Overall, great experience.

These guys get 2 stars for 2 reasons: 1. They still have outside seating 2. The servers do a good job (most of the time) TGIF Manager: read and take notes... your restaurant smells like dirty mop water- ALL THE TIME - We can only stand it for the 2 seconds we have to come in and see the hostess to ask for an outside table. The menu is too cumbersome, it takes like 15 minutes to thumb through all the pages and decide -  So the food is OK - but seriously, the dining area smells ... BAD  Outside seating is good, especially this time of the year when the weather is nice and usually the servers are pretty cool, unfortunately occasionally you will sit next to a table of smokers, but after all, it is outside seating and they are free to smoke. The entertainment value of watching the valet parking attendants abuse the crap out of all those nice cars is also worth the visit (different review). But seriously, do something about the smell and tear out a few pages off the menu, some burgers, quesadillas, fajitas, steak and a couple more things will be just enough -

I can say I had been a Friday's customer for well over 20 years if not more. I am a frequent rewards member and every month would get something with the amount of visits I had. However, this all changed since November.  My last two visits to Fridays have been nothing short of a disaster. Back in November I went with my family of four and our bill was close to 100. Anyone who eats at Fridays will assume that must have been one hearty meal. Well quite the opposite; the waiter was HORRIBLE, SLOW, and not very familiar with the menu and the deals. Our food was cold, delayed they brought everyones meal at a different time, we ordered drinks from the bar and they could not have been more watered down. We had no water for the kids. No manager came to see us and the kicker was when I went to get the point on my card the waiter said he forgot so for me to go online and add them. I left there and called the next day to speak to a manager. She apologized and offered to have us back and I said no because this has been happening quite often the last couple of times ive been to Fridays. Well when the New Year came we were out shopping and my girlfriend decided to eat at Fridays. I forewarned her but let my guard down to what would soon be again a disaster. The bar smelled like absolute Clorox, the waitress was more busy talking to friends than serving our table. The burgers were cold, the orders were wrong, the chicken tasted like rubber...Again money down the drain, and a bad stomach ache for my kids. and, of course no manager in sight...how odd! The next morning when I had spent all night up with my daughters I called and asked to speak with a district manager. The manager came on the phone and after I told her I had a complaint told me to call 1800Fridays. I did, they asked me to not write a comment in Yelp until I would speak with the district manager. That was the icing on the cake. The district manager called me to say that he apologized for my experience but the problem was they were under new management and not everyone was trained. He asked again if I would come back and I said no..after speaking for a while he said he would send me something in the mail for us to go to another Fridays. 3 weeks later and nothing came. I am not saying I would have used it, but clear example that service at TGI Fridays at Dolphin Mall is not what it iused to be. With so many better options like Mojitos, Cheesecake, Buffalo Wild Wings (where the chicken tastes real), Texas de Brasil do not choose Fridays. YOu will have bad service, cold food, watered down drinks and absolutely horrible follow up by management...Wake up people and read the reviews on Yelp!!!! I myself am guilty of not doing so and this paid the price twice..... They will blah blah blah and never take action on your loss of money, time and aggravation

a couple of co workers & i headed out there for happy hour at 4pm since a couple of us had never been there.. & after about 2 hours, they refused to serve us any more drinks...get this..UNTIL WE ORDERED FOOD. Not going to lie, we were feeling good, but not enough to be DRUNK yet.  we had just ate a huge lunch before we got there , so we only wanted drinks. but they insisted we buy something to eat, even though we told them we were not hungry. so we decided to order the cheapest thing on the menu, bread sticks. & we decided to close the tab & head over to the doral ale house where we had a blast!!! .will not be back ever again to that location!! :)
This place doesn't deserve a single star. The service was horrific and the food, when it finally arrived at our table, was cold.
thank  goodness it's friday... thank goodness for a chain like this. reliable food. reliable drinks. reasonable prices.
the service was TERRIBLE!!!! if you want to wait 5 hours for your appetizer then go ahead. service was bad the minute we walked in. good location, ok deals, terrible service.

The service was horrible, the wait was bad. I had the JD Sirloin & Lobster- Med/Well. When I got my order 25 minutes later my Steak was already cold and was way overcooked and smelled like liver. No Lobster on the plate and the parmesan steak fries were way undercooked and hard. They took my order back in and at first the manager came out to apologize and provide a discount of 20%, which I appreciated, but then- 30 minutes later my order came out again- Same thing- or even worse; this time no JD saus, Lobster was overcooked, steak fries still undercooked and my sirloin was hot now but still overcooked. The manager ended up not charging me for the dinner and I ended up not eating anything because the dish was messed up and so was my appetite. My dinner companion finished his meal some 30 minutes ago- needless to say that the whole idea of a dinner together was messed up. Never Again! Bad Bad experience and a server with a attitude.

I want to update this review because I had a much more pleasant lunch experience here recently.  Last time, we were seated near the bar and it smelled like old mop or something.  This time, we asked to be seated in the larger dining area and it made a huge difference.  I like the openness of that area better.  We ordered from the 3 courses for $12.99 menu.  I had quesadillas, a burger, and the brownie sundae.  It was all really good.  Only one complaint.  They wouldn't make my burger Medium, I don't know why.  But, whatever, I'm glad I gave them another shot because it was much better this time around.
decent place to eat and its clean. drinks are expensive and go for the specials for the wallet won't suffer,

Alright, I know all or at least most food chains like Friday's has their food pre cooked. They basically heat up your food and serve. I have not had Friday's in a few years, and I was starving. So I went to the closest place that I saw which was this establishment. I do not know if over the years my palate has become more sensitive or refined I dont know but Friday's stinks. The food is gross. I had a chicken breast with some veggies and my nephew had a burger. He did not like his burger at all it had clumps of that nasty glue food suppliers use to pack your meat together. On top of that the burgers are pre cooked to medium well. MY chicken tasted like rubber and you can tell it was frozen for quite sometime then nuked for me! I dont know if it was the waiter confirming all the food was pre cooked and nuked or what but I was grossed out. Especially when I paid 17 dollares for a tiny microwaved breast and some shrimp. There are tons of place you can order the same and get food fresh and actually cooked upon order. In my opinion Friday's is the worst food chain we got.

Disgusting. It stinks very bad as soon as u walk in. The server didn't want to honor the $5 coupon we had because I ordered the 3 for $16.99, so he said he would give 2 checks to be able to honor it. Well he took extremely long for everything. Took his sweet time was so bad the customers next to us got sick of waiting and left. He never brought those 2 separate checks. I decided to tip him $0. Never going to that location again. You have been warned.

I tried the mozarella and tomatoe salad, it was ok I've had better. We also had a trio of dip with fresh warm tortilla chips. It had Mediterranean hummus, cheese dip, and salsa. Very good appetizer! The drinks were great, we had a few rounds of Long Island Iced Tea and chilled Patron. Great bartenders

OK so we all know i have a thing for burgers so i came here to TGI Friday's. I wasn't planning on ordering a burger but when the waitress came and ask it just spilled out of my mouth. Oops how embarrassing oh well, I ordered what i thought was a bacon cheeseburger. Only because it was named the Cheesy Bacon Cheeseburger wouldn't you but  what I got was something a little different. it was a bacon cheese burger with a cheese stick (sort of) in it. Instead of being a stick it was round and flat like a disk and battered and fried in cheese stick style. so I ate it that way. the burger itself was good. i like the flavor and the texture this out of the ordinary cheese stick gave this burger, its fun and different from the regular same old same old everyday cheeseburgers that other restaurant change give you. I actually liked it and enjoyed eating it and too mention I like the fries too! I mean its TGI Fridays so the service was your same mediocre style service you usually get with these chains on a busy Friday night. However our  food was delivered quite fast. if your ever in Fridays and happen to see this burger  definitely check it out , Its not the greatest one Ive ever had but it is interesting
Good place to go get drinks. There's always happy hour happening. The staff is great, specially the bartenders! Unlimited appetizers are a great del. Good for a night after work to calm down.

I'm not a big fan of food chains like this. However this was my first time coming here in years and the food wasn't that bad, I think it has become slightly better when it comes to taste. I had a mix of appetizers including the corn beef sliders, hibachi beef skewers and the fried Mac & cheese balls. The beers were nice and cold and a friendly bar staff helped the mood. I was surprised that the food would taste this good. I definitely see myself returning for a full course meal.

Oh no... My beloved Fridays. how you have fallen from grace!  You, fellow reader thinking about making the inevitable 20 minute wait on the weekend, turn around and make the wait elsewhere, although disappointment is abound in all Dolphin restaurants.  After waiting for our table, we waited for our waitress. In all honesty, the fact that the service sucks isn't even her fault. The place is super packed but with little servers. When the food gets there, here is what to expect: Cold Food- the overlying theme in all 5 dishes was that they were cold, then placed under heat lamps so now they were warm on top and then stale underneath. Poorly Seasoned Food- the steak and ribs and chicken and turkey burger and cheeseburger all tasted the same and the same isn't even a "good same". The redeeming quality is that when the waitress/waiters do have time, they are usually very friendly and the drinks are still very good.

This place sucks! RUN AWAY!!! Came to visit for the second time after an initial bad impression. Appetizers took half hour to get out. They came out cold. Place wasn't busy, about 10 people total in the whole restaurant including the bar. The potato skins was the only thing not cold and that's because they were scalding hot and I ended up burned myself trying to eat it. It was extremely over fried and grease. Not appetizing at all. Sent it back and ordered spinach flatbread. Another failure, the flatbread was very soggy! Yuck! Couldn't bring myself to pick it up. This is finger food people!!! Ordered the cheddar broccoli soup. Broccoli was raw and not cooked through. Why does a cheddar soup have shredded white cheese on top...??? The soup didn't taste very good, was cold and bland. Ordered the boneless wings and mozzarella sticks. The only thing that was made right and actually edible. But by then I was already getting sick and could finish it. Let very disappointed. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE, DO NOT VISIT EVEN IF YOU'RE DESPERATE. STAFF IS SLOW AND FOOD IS BAD!!!! TASTES LIKE FROZEN FOOD!!!!

Went there on Friday, June 3rd, for happy hour. Food and drinks were delicious but the service was TERRIBLE! Our waitress had a face and attitude that showed she really did not want to be there. Several times we tried to get her attention but she was busy texting. We sat in the bar area and the bartenders spent the entire time throwing bottles around, acting like children, trying to do their best Tom Cruise from Cocktail impersonation. I would have given them one star but the food never disappoints.

Waited 45 minutes for entrees, which is just horrible. No excuses for the delay were provided. Had empty glasses for tens of minutes, despite the fact that multiple waiters and waitresses saw our empty glasses. However, when we requested to see the manager, he gave us a reasonable discount, thus making us not completely dissatisfied with T.G.I.F's. He also promised to speak with his staff regarding our poor experience. After having the bill brought to me, me and my girlfriend sat with it for 10 minutes. After that I ran out of patience, walked to the register and requested to pay the bill immediately. All in all, I cannot recommend this particular T.G.I.F's for anyone.
Horrible service... Hostess didn't acknowledge us until after almost 10 minutes... Waitress still isn't at our table to greet us after another 15... Getting a little frustrated...

I've personally never really cared for Friday's, but they told me about a deal for $12 you can get unlimited appetizers. Before going I called to double check that this Friday's had the offer because I also saw it online, but when I get here I see a deal for $10 you can get your choice of one unlimited appetizer. When I ask the sever for the other deal they said they don't offer that, which I thought was false advertisement. Then he told us that they are currently in happy hour and a few of the appetizers are at $5 which is a good deal. So we each got an appetizer, sliders and mozzarella sticks. They were good, nothing out of this world. The service was great though.

No. Just no. A good 20 minutes after we got seated and no waiter has come by to offer drinks. Don't come to crappy place who tries to call themselves a restaurant. It just is place where they seat and ignore you. After the waiter, Nick, finally toke our order, he disappeared for another 20 minutes and did not show his face for any of that 20 minutes. The apperizer arrived 20 minutes after we ordered, THE DAMN DRINKS CAME LATER THAN THE APPERIZER!!! The manager kept on telling that the waiter would show up but then the manager went off to flirt with the female waitresses. There was no table setting, no utensils or small plates avaliable when we were finally given appetizers after the wait.  No wonder every customer is just sitting around in the booths and tables. I rather wait 3 hours for Cheesecake Factory than this place. Or go to the newer restaurants. I got the Baby Back Rib half rack, it was okay but not worth the hour waiting for them. Just a reminder that the outside of the meat on the ribs is completely burnt but the inside meat is chewy-able. Fries were way over salted. Also, the price of the food does not jusify the quality of the food. Every item is overpriced (I get this is part of the mall but the prices are crazy, even for a mall). The high food prices do not match the poor quality and little quantity of the food. Once again, this food is not worth the wait, especially with the horrible and unprofessional service. Avoid this place at all costs.

Our server was the best part of the meal. Fridays is my usual no-fail restaurant...I have been to numerous locations across the U.S. so I know what to expect. I have favorites on the menu that never disappoint. However, this particular location wasn't the greatest. I had several problems with my order (no fault of my server, rather the kitchen) and the bathroom was horrid.  I understand Dolphin Mall serves a lot of people but they need their cleaning people to be in the bathroom round the clock...if that is where the kitchen staff is washing their hands....(yuck)! Food/experience was so-so. Could have been better. TGI is a chain so I would never complain about the overall menu items but my personal experience at their various locations and this particular one was less than stellar.  2.5 stars, generous enough to round to 3.
My server was timid and attentive.  The table was dirty and had crumbs on the bench.  Otherwise, she made my stay worth it.  Thanks !
Worst service ever... A drink tool around 30 minutes, tge refil didn't even got here.... I think they had around 15 people... Never coming back

Went in at around 10:30 pm and was not greeted by anyone for five minutes even though it was empty. Servers and bar tenders looked at us and didn't bother to greet us or ask if we needed to be seated. This is not how you keep customers coming back to a location.

Horrible service! Had to wait for 10 minutes to be taken to a table on a thursday afternoon. The food took almost 45 minutes to be ready. Most of the employees where horsing around. I do not recommend this TGI Friday.

Please closed your doors. The worst food i had in the past ten years. We order the turkey burger and it was bad, so bad that the bread was cold. The appetizers looked and tasted from the microwave. Last time i came to your restaurant was about 5 years ago and now i know why i waited so long too vomit. Please save your money and go to golden arches. The two starts i gave you was for service, she was actually very nice.

Our group had terrible service from the waiter Adrian. Ignored our table, never brought drinks and forgot multiple items we asked for with our food. Had to ask other staff to even refill our drinks. Only time he was attentive was when it was time to pay our bills. Not eating here again.

Worst food ever. The lemonade was made with bitters and water from the bar. The blueberry Long Island was just as bitter. The food was horrible and they gave me the wrong order twice. The bartenders have no idea what they are doing and the chefs are just as bad. But at least out waitress was amazing. Cute short girl with a red bandana. Forgot her name. She was the only good part of this whole experience here. My boyfriend and I will not be returning.
We spent great time past sunday with some friends, RIBS were AMAZING (as usual) I hope back soon :)

We were there last night 9/30/15 ...It took TGI 15 mns to seat our party of four even though it was empty...AND an hour to serve us! The Manager "Roberto"was horrible, very rude and insulted me by asking me if the food he was bringing to my party was just for me!  The waitress "Marisol" overcharged me by $30 and could not explain to me "why" by giving me 3 different answers. I expected the 'endless" appetizers to be $10 unlimited as advertised but she charged me PER plate (4 plates of appetizers) and never explained the deal to me!!! and refused to give me a credit OR apologize!.  I will never go back there, they ruined our evening and my wallet! A HORRIBLE restaurant to go to!!!!

You'll get your typical Friday's food, no huge deal there. The place is disgusting though. It's dark, the tables are sticky and old, and for some reason it's always wet. Bathroom is all wet too. To top it off, the service is never good. I've had unresponsive waiters, half full shots, and bartenders lie about the prices.  You're better off going to the food court.

I came here on a Saturday afternoon to have drinks with my sister, although their menu is not my favorite, my sister insisted as she comes here quite often. Unfortunately as we were ordering drinks my sister was told her ID needed to be swipe on a little machine they have to verified her age. She is over 21 but she has a vertical ID and the magnetic strip is faded. The first manager came, intended to swipe ID and said it will not work, we asked her to see her date of birth to verified ID and she said it was fine. We assumed my sister will be getting her drink as this is the first time they mentioned such policy, which by the way is not in the entrance, neither drink menu. As I got my drink and my boyfriend, we asked what about her drink to our server and he mentioned he couldn't serve her the drink. We asked to see the manager and another manager came with the machine, intending to swipe the ID again. As we explained her the other manager had tried to do it and since ID is faded on the back she left not saying anything about my sister not able to get the drink. We would it have left right there, however after asking our server on her drink status he bought another manager and this manager said they base on policy need to be able to verified ID. We asked what is the machine supposed to said and she said the age. So we asked her to verified date of birth on ID which clearly states her age but she insisted the machine needed to verify it. So I asked her why is her policy no stated in the door for users to be aware before they even consider going in. She had nothing to say, we requested the bill and she mentioned we still needed to pay for the other drinks that were bought to the table, even though we didnt touch them. I think it is ridiculous they don't have this policy listed on their door, i would not have wasted 30 minutes of my Saturday otherwise. Based on this situation, i will never come back.

I have not been to this Friday in a while but the portions are smaller and the service was not what you would expect from such a reputable chain restaurant.  We waited over 45 for our food. I will not be returning to this location.  I recommend trying the Cheesecake Factory

I gave it a star because there's no lower rating possible.  Tried to have dinner there with friends after the movies.  We were a party of 14, they said they could accommodate us.  However, from sitting down to having our food order taken was a 50 minute wait.  That only happened because we went to see the hostess to inquire who would take our order.  By the time the food came out another 45 minutes later most of it was wrong and 2 of the younger kids had already fallen asleep without dinner.  Dessert was another fiasco with another 50 minute wait, 2 more of the kids in our party had fallen asleep due to the long wait.  When we asked to speak to the manager all she could say even though she could see 6 out of the 8 kids asleep was that our wait hadn't seem that long.  Horrible service, horrible food, and management is part of the problem! Stay away from this place!!!

I haven't had one of their entrees in a while since they had fallen off a bit, but I may have to give one a try and update this review later. That being said, The pick there for 15 is awesome! I love the corned beef sliders, tuna crisps, and fried Mac n cheese!  Aside from that, the bruschetta is decent and the drink prices are reasonable. I want to go four stars, but entrees sucked real bad last time I came and it's a low end chain, so three stars with a possible 4 in the future. Hell, they had a great salmon pasta dish many years ago, so if they just put that back on the menu I'm in! Lol
